721744f-a.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Chatham Square
721744f-a.text:

Street.
October 8, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

721746f-a.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Park Street
721746f-a.text:
13 Mott Street, west side, between Chatham Scuare and Park Street.
The view shows the lower story of building, containing the Mootie
Temple.
October 28, 1927.

722466f.title: Manhattan: Park Row - Chatham Square
722466f.text:
Park Row, south from Chatham Square, showing the street level
overshadowed by the City Hall division of the 2nd and 3rd Avenue
''E1'' line. ' In the background are the Municipal and Federal Court
House buildings. The photographer's vantage point is the platform
of the South Ferry division on New Bowery.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
NNO RPPRODT:TIOS
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
''Portrait of 1. Y.'' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
722466f.folder: Park Row & Chatham Square, Manhattan, NY

721745f.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Park Street
721745f.text:
Mott Street, north side, east from a point in line of
Park Street, to the Chatham ~cuare (right), showing a
portion of New York's Chinatown. At the left is the
distinctive structure housing the Chinese Empire Reform
Association and a Joss House. This is No. 20 Mott St.
It also provided entrance to the enclosed passageway to
Doyers Street, emerging at the ''Bloody Angle''.
View 2 is a photostatic reproduction of the original.
About 1900
No's. 1-2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAy BE REPRODUCED
